text.title: part14_Augusten Burroughs on addiction, writing, his family and his new book

p: AB: You know? I like being able to just-- I like that this book is going to show another side.
head: On women's breasts and tattoos

p.hi: DS: What's your favorite curse word?

p: AB: My favorite curse word? Let me think about that . . . . I like "cunt."

p.hi: DS: [Chuckles] That's always the one that--

p: AB: It seems to offend so many people still.
AB: There's something about it I like, or--

p.hi: DS: It’s a cutting word. Do you have a favorite euphemism for women's breasts?

p: AB: Oh yeah, let's see…what do I call them…? I like the old-fashioned words for breasts, like "boobies." I like "boobies," um "girls," "my girls" or "your girls”; I like the idea of naming breasts, like "Jen" and "Stacy." I think every girl should name each breast. "Stacy hangs a little lower"; "Stacy needs a tuck, but Beth doesn't."

p.hi: DS: [Chuckles] What would you name your breasts?

p: AB: I would name them--"Regina" and "Claire."

p.hi: DS: Would Claire be the bigger one?

p: AB: I'm glad I don't have them--actually, if I had them, I would have them sawed off. I wouldn't be able to stand it.
AB: Yeah, I'd be like, "Chop these fucking things off."

p.hi: DS: You're not like most gay men who have a fascination with breasts?

p: AB: I would want them gone. They look uncomfortable.

p.hi: DS: Do you like them on other people?
DS: Do you have a breast fetish?

p: AB: No, because you know what, I saw this picture of this woman who had breast cancer, and she had a radical mastectomy, and she had these massive scars, and then she had them tattooed. And I thought that it looked soooo cool. She looked great and she was in shape. And I thought it would make me want breast cancer if I'd seen that picture; I would have thought, "I want it!"

p.hi: DS: My sister has stretch marks on her stomach that she's really self-conscious about--
DS: We've been talking about that!
DS: I had suggested to her tattooing a band of stars across it, that--

p: AB: Oh, what a great idea!

p.hi: DS: Yeah, like where it starts out small, and goes like bigger over the marks?

p: AB: Yes. Yep. That's a beautiful idea.

p.hi: DS: And she was all for it. We were going to take her to my tattoo guy, over here on First Avenue--
DS: And she all of a sudden has been like, "Mmmmm, I don't really know." And she's like, "Maybe I'm going to get a belly button ring." But that's going to highlight it!
